review: This unit is GREAT! I have a TV with internet connection support however, what do I do, run a line or buy a wireless dongle?Neither!  With the CHROMECAST device, I was able to easily connect to my network. What is special about that, it was only $35 investment.When I use the Chrome browser from my phone or laptop, I can CAST to the CHROMECAST device, thus displaying the browser display to the TV.I also have a NAS so any media that I have on it can be played on the TV.Only a couple of apps to download to both the computer and phone.The CHROMECAST plugs into the HDMI port on the TV, and requires power. The power is connected through a miniUSB port on the device and if you TV has a USB port, the cable will connect there. If the TV's USB port doesn't supply enough power don't worry. The CHROMECAST comes with a AC power unit which plugs into your house power and just plug the USB cable into the port on the power unit.Don't forget to select the HDMI input on the TV to connect to the CHROMECAST.WHAT A DEAL!
author: William R. Mchugh "Mr Bill"

review: I purchased this to take on travel with me and use it in the hotel rooms. I thought it would be portable and convenient for this purpose. Unfortunately, it does not work in most hotels due to the wifi factor. The chrome cast is not set up for that. There is no option on the chrome cast to overpass the security or put in a password that the hotel wifi uses. There is limited use with the device, but is fine for at home viewing for only Netflix and you tube. Do your research before you purchase. I usually do, but not thoroughly this time and now I will barely use this item, so I may just give it away since I already have Apple TV. Good product otherwise, but not for travel purposes.
